metadata.title: CVE-2021-35613 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Cluster product of Oracle MySQL (component:Cluster: General). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.26 andprior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attackerwith network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Cluster.Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized abilityto cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) of MySQL Cluster. CVSS3.1 Base Score 3.7 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-35613` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-client - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-router - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-server - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.27-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
